thread.title: Local roundup: Old Lyme remains unbeaten with 6-0 win in boys' soccer
thread.title_full: Local roundup: Old Lyme remains unbeaten with 6-0 win in boys' soccer

author: Day Staff Reports
title: Local roundup: Old Lyme remains unbeaten with 6-0 win in boys' soccer
text:
Local roundup: Old Lyme remains unbeaten with 6-0 win in boys' soccer Published October 01. 2015 11:12PM Day Staff Reports 
Old Lyme — Joel Driscoll had two goals and Cooper St. Germain a goal and two assists for the Old Lyme High School boys’ soccer team in a 6-0 victory Thursday over North Branford in the Shoreline Conference. 
Dan Reid, Jack Machnik and Nate Peduzzi added goals and Peduzzi had an assist for the Wildcats (5-0-3, 4-0-2). Cam Dean-Frazier and Brian Winters combined for the shutout. 
North Branford is 1-5, 0-5. 
In other games: 
• Eric Ross had a goal and an assist as Montville beat Killingly 2-0 in an Eastern Connecticut Conference Medium Division game. Joel Morth scored a goal, Noah Cook had an assist and Nik Strickland made four saves for Montville (6-1,1 3-0-1). 
• Nick Ghirardi had a goal and assisted on James Foster's goal in East Lyme's 2-0 win over Griswold. Goalie Mike Trailor had six saves for the Vikings (7-1). 
Girls' soccer 
• Lauren Veile made nine saves for Norwich Tech in a 3-0 loss to Parish Hill. Jaida Davis scored twice for Parish Hill. Norwich Tech is 5-2. 
H.S. volleyball 
• Alaina Moger had 13 assists as Waterford remained unbeaten in the ECC Medium Division with a 25-13, 25-8, 25-16 win over Ledyard. Jill Sykora had four aces and 15 service points and Mikayla Tourjee had eight kills for Waterford (7-2, 4-0). Jenna Boyd had six blocks and Ahna Harkness had three aces and five assists for Ledyard (1-8, 1-3). 
• Grasso Tech beat Metro Learning Center 25-18, 25-14, 25-21 in a CSC match on Wednesday. Kiera Sebastian had 14 points and five aces, Patience Hamilton had 11 points and Vanessa Parra had 10 points and four aces for Grasso (2-4). 
Girls' cross country 
• Stonington remained unbeaten with a 25-32 victory over Ledyard on Wednesday. Ledyard's Megan Brawner won the race in 20 minutes, 7 seconds, leading from start to finish, but Stonington placed four of the top six runners, led by Caroline Morehouse (2nd, 20:37) and Maia Smith (21:04). Ledyard is 3-3. 
Boys' cross country 
• Jacob Money was first (17:56) and Aaron Norcia second (18:15), as Ledyard swept Stonington 18-44 and Wheeler 15-49. Josh Snow (4th), Christian Kuss (5th) and Geralson Withrow (6th) rounded out the scoring for Ledyard (7-0), which had seven of the top 10 runners. Stonington defeated Wheeler 19-38, led by Kieran Thornell, who was third. Anton Smith (9th) was the top finisher for Wheeler (2-5). Stonington is 3-4. 
Local golf 
• Bill Hermanson, who's from East Lyme and plays out of Black Hall Club in Old Lyme, finished second in the rain-shortened New Engnland Senior Amateur Championship at Oyster Harbors Club in Osterville, Mass. Bad weather forced the cancellation of Wednesday's second round. Dave Houghton, 71, was crowned the winner, posting a 3-under 69. Hermanson trailed by two strokes. 
• Emily Mazzola of Groton recently scored a hole-in-one on the 162-yard seventh hole on the red course at Elmridge in Pawcatuck. She accomplished the feat using a driver while playing in the Nuclear Design Golf League on Sept. 28. 
• Robin Smith recently defeated Jane Barry to win the Mohegan Sun's Ladies Club Championship. Peg Ververis beat Gail Gale in the First Flight. 
• Norwich Golf Course captured the annual Norwich/Shennecossett Challenge on Saturday. The match was played at Norwich.
